creditline: The Ruth Ann Dayton Chinese Room Endowment Fund
description: small, round lotus-pod-shaped box with cover and metal insert; movable "seeds" in cover
dimension: 1 1/2 x 2 1/2 x 2 1/2 in. (3.81 x 6.35 x 6.35 cm) (closed, overall)
text: This unusual container is crafted in the general shape of a lotus pod with stylized petals on the side. The removable lid is carved with small, round openings which  acted as air vents for the crickets that were kept within. Gourd and wooden cricket containers were generally used during the cooler months.
title: Cricket Box
